dietary_restrictions: None specified, but a focus on whole, unprocessed foods, high protein, high complex carbohydrates, moderate healthy fats, and anti-inflammatory ingredients for bulking and elbow recovery.
meal_plan:
Here is your delicious and effective Indian meal plan for tomorrow, 2025-09-07, designed to fuel your Legs & Core workout, support your bulking goals, and aid in your elbow recovery. We're focusing on nutrient-dense, anti-inflammatory foods to keep you strong and help you heal!

**Breakfast (Pre-Workout - consume 1.5-2 hours before your Legs & Core session):**
*   **High-Protein Vegetable Quinoa Upma with Sprouted Moong Dal:** A hearty and easily digestible meal packed with complex carbohydrates for sustained energy and a significant protein boost. Quinoa is an excellent gluten-free grain, and sprouted moong dal adds a punch of plant-based protein, fiber, and micronutrients, essential for muscle repair and general well-being. Feel free to load it with your favorite vegetables like peas, carrots, and bell peppers, along with a pinch of turmeric for its anti-inflammatory properties.
    *   *Approximate Macronutrients:* Carbs: 55-70g, Protein: 25-35g, Fats: 5-10g

**Lunch (Post-Workout - consume within 30-60 minutes after your Legs & Core session):**
*   **Lean Chicken Curry with Brown Rice and Palak Sabzi (Spinach Stir-fry):** This meal is designed for optimal post-workout recovery. Lean chicken provides the high-quality protein needed for muscle repair and growth, while brown rice delivers complex carbohydrates to replenish glycogen stores. The Palak Sabzi, rich in iron, vitamins, and antioxidants, further supports overall recovery and is excellent for reducing inflammation.
    *   *Approximate Macronutrients:* Carbs: 70-90g, Protein: 35-45g, Fats: 10-15g

**Dinner:**
*   **Healthy Tilapia Fish Curry with Bajra Roti (Pearl Millet Flatbread) and Mixed Vegetable Sabzi:** A perfect dinner for continued muscle recovery and anti-inflammatory support. Tilapia is a lean protein source, and the curry can be made with anti-inflammatory ingredients like turmeric, ginger, and garlic. Fish is also an excellent source of Omega-3 fatty acids, crucial for reducing inflammation and supporting joint health. Bajra roti provides wholesome complex carbohydrates, and the mixed vegetable sabzi ensures you get a wide array of vitamins, minerals, and fiber.
    *   *Approximate Macronutrients:* Carbs: 40-55g, Protein: 30-40g, Fats: 10-15g (depending on oil in sabzi/curry)
